line2: dwarf-in-charge is called Gilob, find

line4: guard just as soon as we mop up these remaining goblins.

line1: Hello, any news from the watchman?
Not yet...
I have some terrible news for you Captain,
line2: the goblins over ran the tower, your
line3: guards fought well but were overwhelmed.

line1: You give the Dwarf Captain his subordinate's remains...
I can't believe it, Gilob was the finest
line2: lieutenant I had! We'll give him a fitting
line3: funeral, but what of his command? His
line4: son, Lollk, was with him. Did you find his body too?

line1: No, there was only one body there, I searched pretty well.
The goblins must have taken him. Please
line2: traveler, seek out the goblins' hideout
line3: and return the lad to us. They always
line4: attack from the South-east, so they must be based down there.

line1: Okay, I'll see if I can find their hideout.
Thank the heavens, you saved me! I thought
line2: I'd be goblin lunch for sure!

line1: Are you okay?
I think so, I'd better run off home.
That's right, you get going, I'll catch up.
Thanks again, brave adventurer.
Lollk has returned and I thank you from
line2: the bottom of my heart - without you he'd
line3: be a goblin barbecue!

line1: Always a pleasure to help.
